title: For Sale:  Juggernaut Arms - Walther PPQ M2
postcontent:
Manufacturer : Walther Model : PPQ m2Caliber : 9mm Capacity : 17rd. (2) magazines Features : great ergonomics, button style mag releaseThe Walther PPQ is a short recoil-operated locked breech semi-automatic pistol that uses a modified Browning cam-lock system adapted from the Hi-Power pistol. The PPQ has a glassfiber-reinforced polymer frame and steel slide assembly. It can be broken down into its main parts or field stripped with a take down catch without the help of tools.
FeaturesEdit
The internal preset striker 'Quick Defense'trigger of the PPQ is a departure from previous Walther pistols and has been developed for the PPQ.[9] When the trigger is pulled, the trigger bar engages a disconnect lever, which props up a sear hook, which releases the fully pre-loaded striker assembly, firing the pistol. Pulling the trigger does not partially load the striker spring as with theGlock and many other striker fired pistol designs. The PPQ trigger pull is entirely due to the trigger and disconnector springs. The PPQ has a trigger travel of approximately 9 mm(0.4 in) with a relatively short trigger reset of 2.5 mm (0.1 in) and a trigger pull of approximately 25 N (5.6 lbf). Unlike many other trigger systems, preset internal strikers have a let-off point and trigger pull that remains unchanged from the first shot to the last and requires no decocker. It should be noted that the striker of the PPQ variant does not protrude from the back of the slide, as the firearm is in a constant cocked state.

title: For Sale:  Nightforce SHV 5-20x56 MOAR Riflescope C535
postcontent: Nightforce SHV 5-20x56 MOAR Riflescope C535 The new 5-20 x 56 SHV™ provides even greater extended-range capability to any shooter; a variable power range ideal for most big game hunting environments; and the precision that comes with high magnification for the predator and varmint hunter. It reinforces the Nightforce commitment to make the company’s renowned quality and performance available to greater numbers of hunters and shooters through the more affordable SHV™ line.The 5-20 x 56 SHV™ is available in illuminated and non-illuminated reticle models. Illuminated versions feature center-only reticle illumination, which helps prevent low-light flare common to some “smart” reticles. External illumination control is incorporated into the side parallax adjustment. Parallax settings are marked in yards, and adjustments can be made quickly without removing the eye from the shooting position.The same Nightforce-designed reticles offered with the 4-14 x 56 SHV™ are available in the 5-20 x 56: the IHR™ (International Hunting Reticle), an uncluttered, fast three-post design with floating center crosshair, applicable for use on virtually any game; and the MOAR™, an extremely effective minute-of-angle-based reticle that provides accurate rangefinding and hold-offs, even on small targets at long distances. Capped elevation and windage adjustments have .25 MOA click values, yielding 10 MOA per revolution of the dial. Total travel is 80 MOA elevation, 50 MOA windage within the 30mm tube. The new 5-20 x 56 SHV™ comes standard with Nightforce ZeroSet™ technology that allows a rapid return to the shooter’s chosen zero point, even after multiple rotations of the elevation adjustment.The same engineering and performance that persuaded Outdoor Life’s editors to select the 4-14 x 56 SHV™ as their “Editor’s Choice” for 2014 are evident in its bigger brother. “We’ve been able to create a line of riflescopes that will outperform any in their class or price range by limiting the number of options available and using a less complex manufacturing process than our NXS™ series,” said Kyle Brown, Nightforce director of sales and marketing. “All we lowered was the price—not our standards.”The 5-20 x 56 SHV™ provides exceptional clarity, resolution and color contrast across its entire magnification range, unlike many lesser variable-power scopes that exhibit a marked deterioration of quality toward the higher end of their power ranges. Manufacturer Part No: C535  Scope Weight: 30.5 oz. It gets the same precision fit as these pistols, too. Add in the same national match stainless steel barrel, and you have a pistol that shoots well beyond its price tag. The Range Officer® Compact is topped with a fiber optic front sight and a low profile combat rear sight, so you have maximum visibility. The beavertail grip safety, extended lightweight trigger and flat mainspring housing allow the pistol to sit in your hand comfortably for long periods of time at the range. The single-sided thumb safety keeps things simple and functional. It all adds up to a pistol that will let you seriously compete in a variety of matches.The Range Officer® Compact means that your favorite range pistol is now easier to carry.    FAMILY:1911 Style Pistol Series    MODEL:Range Officer    TYPE:Semi-Auto Pistol    ACTION:Single Action    FINISH:Black    STOCK/FRAME:Steel Frame    STOCK/GRIPS:Cocobolo Checkered Grips    CALIBER/GAUGE:9mm    CAPACITY:9+1    # OF MAGS:2    MAGAZINE DESC:9 rd.    BARREL:4"    SIGHTS:Fiber Optic    SAFETY:Extended Thumb Safety    ADDL INFO:Paddle Holster    ADDL INFO:Double Mag Pouch

title: For Sale/Trade:  Sig Sauer P226 Mk25 9mm
postcontent:
Up for sale/trade is a lightly used Sig Sauer Mk25 P226 pistol in 9mm.  As the version marketed as being identical to that issued to SEALs, it has a few differences from other versions of the P226.  First, the rail is a standard mil-spec rail rather than the proprietary rail on other Sigs.  Second, the internals are phosphate-coated for corrosion resistance.  Third, it has a UID inventory label on the frame and a small anchor engraved on the side of the slide.  It also has factory night sites.  I purchased it new and it is well cared for.  It has had around 200 rounds through it and the only wear is the normal slight finish wear expected on the barrel  and hood.  It includes box, papers, and three (3) fifteen round magazines.  

I'm primarily offering this for cash sale; however I may be interested in firearm trades that include some cash on your end.  You must be at least 21 and have a valid Ohio driver's license (CCW preferred.)

The P-32 is a semi-automatic, locked breech pistol, chambered for the .32 Auto cartridge. The firing mechanism is double action only. The magazine has a 7 round capacity. The Kel-Tec P-32 is the lightest .32 Auto pistol ever made. Thanks to its locking dynamics and superior ergonometry, perceived recoil and practical accuracy are comparable to much larger guns. The P-32 is mainly intended for plainclothes police officers as a secondary weapon, or for concealed carry by licensed citizens. The small grip size and light trigger pull make the P-32 ideal for female shooters.

title: For Sale:  BARRETT 82A1 .50 BMG W/29" BARREL, SWAROVSKI OPTIK SCOPE, PELICAN 1750 CASE, 4 MAGAZINES
postcontent:
BARRETT MODEL 82A1

The Barrett 82A1 stands at the pinnacle of firearm design, and has been proven in long-range accuracy, ruggedness, and dependability in any environment (military or civilian). The low recoil and self-loading action of the 82A1 created it’s own hallmark! If you are anything like me, the more that you research the engineering that goes into the Barrett Model 82A1, the more you will be inspired by the close tolerances and meticulous engineering that has gone into every single part of this gun. It is unparalleled.

I was so overwhelmed by Barrett’s development of the Model 82A1, that I got this rifle to hold onto. I am the sole owner, and this rifle has remained new and unfired, to this day. It has been well maintained and stored in climate-controlled conditions with thorough cleaning and lubrication regularly. I NEVER intended to sell this beautiful gun, but must now due to financial necessity.

If you are unfamiliar with the Barrett Model 82A1, please watch some of the You Tube demonstrative videos of this rifle. There simply are NO Comparables.

The Swarovski Optik high-performance scope is made in Western Austria by Swarovski; a family business that was established in 1895 after Daniel Swarovski invented the first electric grinding machine for jewelry stores. In 1935, Wilhelm Swarovski pursued his passion for astronomy and built far better optics for telescopes than the world had ever seen. This gave rise to Swarovski Optik, a company that still stands firmly behind their products. I believe this to be the best scope, atop the best rifle.

The Pelican 1750 case for the Barrett Model 82A1 is built like a tank, and is specially designed for the 82A1. It is watertight, crushproof, and dustproof, and comes with a Lifetime Guarantee of Excellence. It measures 53” Length X 16” Width X 6.12” Depth, and is made of polypropylene with stainless steel bearings. It comes with a side handle, end handle, and roller wheels.

I cannot bring myself to piece out the gun, so I am selling it with all of the accessories. EVERYTHING IS IN NEW CONDITION. This includes everything detailed in the attached photos, including:

BARRETT MODEL 82A1 .50 BMG CALIBER SEMI-AUTOMATIC RIFLE WITH CHROME CHAMBER AND BLACK ANODIZED FINISH

29” FLUTED BARREL WITH 4” MUZZLE BRAKE

1 TURN IN 15” BARREL RIFLING

BACK-UP IRON SIGHTS

SWAROVSKI (PREMIER AUSTRIAN) 10X SCOPE WITH SCOPE RINGS 4 – BARRETT MODEL 82A1 10-ROUND MAGAZINES

PELICAN MODEL 1750 ROLLING CASE FOR BARRETT MODEL 82A1 IN BLACK

BARRETT MODEL 82A1 CLEANING KIT

title: For Sale:  Model 1936 French Manufacture d'Armes de Saint-Elienne (MAS)
postcontent:
Model 1936 French Manufacture d'Armes de Saint-Elienne (MAS) The Model 1936 French MAS was the MBR (main battle rifle) For all French Forces during WW2. Yes France surrendered to Germany but by the time of the invasion of Europe there were 1.3 million Free French fighting for the Allies. This 
was their MBR. It also served with them as a MBR during the Korean War, Algerian War, 1st Indochina Was, Suez Crisis, it served the Viet Cong durng 
the Vietnam war and both sided during the Cambodian Civil war. In 1953 in order to conform to NATO standards all French MBRs were converted to 
7.62x51 (308) and the Model 1936 was relegated to sniper duty. This Rifle has got the three screw mount system on the side indicating it was one of their sniper rifles which means this rifle remained in service with the French military until 1984. I have found the scope mounting hardware and have put a scope on the rifle. The scope is not the Leaper like the Original had but a Bushnell 3x-9x40 and have also add a lace on cheek plate to lift the eye up to the scope level There is a 12 inch spike bayonet stored in the rifle under the barrel in a storage tube. it is mounted by turning it around and sticking the handle into the storage space. Also it has a nice leather strap.

title: For Sale:  Smith & Wesson Model 52-2 semi automatic pistol
postcontent:
WOW! It was a pistol target shooters could only dream about. A Smith & Wesson Model 52-2 chambered for .38 Special, mid range, wadcutter ammunition. Meaning it is one of the original models manufactured between 1969 and 1993 where only a few thousand units were produced. Serial number is A483274. The extension made the sight accuracy better without having a longer barrel. Now for the condition, I rate this firearm to be in Good condition. Please note the pictures.  This pistol is known for its accuracy, and “to insure the accuracy of thepistol,extra-rigid inspection was incorporated by having the Model 52 machine rest tested at 50 yards to assure that the pistol would shoot 5-shot groups having a maximum spread of two inches. Any pistol that could not meet this standard was returned to production for reworking.” The slide action has no sway or loose feel at all due to its closely fitted barrel bushing. The trigger pull is perfection at its best.   
This model has the reputation of being one of the most accurate handguns ever made.  The original grips are checkered walnut grips with Smith and Wesson monograms. The gun has a serrated trigger and hammer with adjustable trigger stop., 2lbs trigger pull...crisp and clean. Included with this pistol are 3 magazines. The grips are sharp with no losses or cracks. All markings are deep. The finish is factory original. 
Shipping is available.

For Sale:  Browning BLR Lightweight ’81 Stainless Takedown .308 Win Rifle, 20 Inch, Satin Finish, Browning 034015118
postcontent:
We have hundreds of other guns currently IN STOCK, and offer some of Utah’s lowest prices! For a complete listing of our current inventory, and to purchase this and other guns online, please be sure to VISIT US ON THE WEB AT:   ***** TooeleShootingSupply.com *****  
Rugged and rowdy, right down to its very core, the BLR Lightweight ’81 Stainless is ready to take on the toughest hunting conditions you (and Mother Nature) can dish out. The satin finish on the laminated gray hardwood stock, the satin-nickel finish on the receiver and the matte finish on the stainless barrel mean no reflections will spook your trophy buck. The TRUGLO/Marbles fiber-optic front sight lets you draw a fine bead in low light conditions. This is what a serious lever-action hunting rifle should be, and what every other lever-action wishes it was.
 
–The button-Rifled barrel is triple-checked for straightness and interior finish and then air-gauged to ensure a consistent diameter throughout the bore’s length.–Every BLR barrel is individually finished with a hand-reamed chamber for tighter tolerances and more precise headspace.–The barrel’s target-type Crown enables a more uniform release of gas as the bullet exits the muzzle, helping prevent any unwanted shift in bullet trajectory. The barrel Crown is recessed to help protect it from accidental impact damage that can degrade accuracy.–The barrel’s standard sights include a Low-Profile adjustable square notch rear sight and a high-visibility fiber-optic front blade on a raised ramp-style base.?–The satin nickel finish on the receiver beautifully matches the satin stainless barrel finish.–The takedown models of the BLR are unique, allowing you to simply flip a finger lever, twist the receiver and barrel 90 degrees and instantly separate the two parts for space saving storage or easy transportation, even in a backpack or hunting duffle. Reassembly is in reverse order and takes only seconds.–The barrel on BLR Takedown models is factory drilled and tapped for an optional Browning forward-mounted scout-style scope base to provide a rock-solid optics mounting platform, allowing you to remove the barrel for transportation and storage without losing your scope’s zero.–The aircraft grade alloy receiver is precision machined to provide outstanding reliability and years of dependable service.–The slick-sided receiver houses the BLR’s lightning fast, glass-smooth rack and pinion lever action.–The BLR has a rotating multi-lug bolt head that locks into the barrel extension to produce bolt-action accuracy and magnum-level strength.–The BLR is one of the few lever-action rifle designs that is strong enough to use today’s most popular magnum cartridges, giving you the extended reach and flat bullet trajectory other lever-action owners can only dream of.–The BLR has a recessed bolt face that surrounds the cartridge head for added strength and lasting dependability.–The BLR’s generously-sized side ejection port allows fired cases to instantly clear the action without hitting you or your scope and bouncing back onto the receiver, potentially creating a jam.–The folding hammer on the BLR provides an added measure of safety when the hammer is at half-cock, having two positions in that mode so the status of the rifle can be instantly seen and felt.–The folding hammer on the BLR has four basic positions; Full-cock, half-cock, folded hammer position and the dropped or fired position.–The BLR’s trigger is unique in that it travels along with the lever as it’s cycled, meaning that pinching your fingers between the lever and trigger on closing the action is a thing of the past.–The fingerpiece on the BLR’s trigger is nice and wide with vertical friction ribs to prevent your finger from slipping, giving you more precise trigger control for those demanding long-range shots.–The detachable steel box magazine makes for quick reloading, both in the field and on the range.–Unlike lever actions with tubular magazines, the BLR’s detachable steel box magazine lets you use aerodynamically-superior pointed bullets, which opens up a whole new world of ballistic performance that is usually found in bolt-action and autoloading rifles.–Magazine capacity is 3 rounds in the magnum calibers and 4 rounds in standard calibers.–The BLR’s laminated stock is sculpted from a satin gray finished hardwood for no-nonsense durability and the cut checkering in the grip and fore-end is crisply executed for lasting good looks and a more solid grip.

title: For Sale:  Smith & Wesson 357 Model 27-2
postcontent:
Smith & Wesson 357 Model 27-2 with 5 inch barrel. Serial number N167289. Firearms is in excellent Condition.  Ready to Ship. Buy It Now!! When first introduced by Smith & Wesson in 1935 it was known as the Registered Magnum. The model was essentially a custom order revolver.  Each Registered Magnum came with a certificate of authenticity. 
Even though it was introduced in the middle of the Great Depression and was extremely expensive, Smith & Wesson found itself backlogged with orders for the four years that it produced the Registered Magnum. The Kansas City Police Department issued the Registered Magnum to its officers, and many other law enforcement officers across the United States carried the Registered Magnum. In 1939 Smith & Wesson stopped producing the Registered Magnum. It was replaced with the .357 Magnum. The .357 Magnum was available with barrel lengths of 3.5", 5", 6.5" and 8.75". Essentially the .357 Magnum was still the Registered Magnum, but standardized for ease of production and economy. The Smith & Wesson Model 28 "Highway Patrolman" was introduced as a lower cost version of the Model 27 in 1954, stripped of some of the features of the Model 27, such as polishing. 
It was noted for its durability and reliability. It was extremely popular with FBI agents from the 1940s through the 1960s. Skeeter Skelton considered the Model 27 with a 5" barrel as the best all around handgun. General George Patton carried an ivory handled Registered Magnum with a 31/2 inch barrel (along with his ivory handled Colt Peacemaker); Patton called the Model 27 his "killing gun." 
This model features the target style trigger and hammer and the rare 5" barrel. Single-action trigger is phenomenal on this piece, bright clean bore and smooth action. 
All pictures are of actual firearm, and best represent it. I have more pictures if requested.

title: For Sale:  Colt All American 2000, 9 MM
postcontent: This is a very unusual Colt double action semi-auto with a roller bearing trigger.  It has a recoil operated rotary action featuring integrated locking lugs similar to the M-16 rifle.  The gun is hammerless, has a 4 1/2" barrel, a matte finish steel slide and a polymer receiver.  It comes with a 15 shot mag with an ambidexrous mag release and black synthetic checkered grips.  The gun was only manufactured from 1991-1993 and was discontinued due to manufacturing difficulties and high cost to make.  A very unique gun that will only go up in value.  Overall condition of the gun is excellent, with just a slight bit of bluing loss on the slide release.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Savage 210 slug gun   SALE PENDING
postcontent: Savage 210 12 gauge slug gun with a 24" rifled barrel,  an American made Redfield  3x9 scope, and an SCI sling.  This gun was made in the 1990's and is similar to the 212 but better quality. The 210 has a stronger smooth acting bolt with a shorter throw (60°), a stronger and more reliable extractor, and shorter spacing between scope bases for short and medium length scopes without the use of extension rings. The reviews on these guns are excellent with many hunters saying the 210 has rifle like accuracy at 200 yards with quality slugs such as the Remington Premier AccuTip 385 grain Bonded Sabot Slug. I'm quite sure that's why these guns are getting hard to find with many days when there are none available on Armslist Nationwide. I could put only one picture with the ad but will send more of whatever you'd like to see.

I have a Ruger SR40c, used once at the range; recently bought an M&P in 9mm and won't need this handgun. Handgun is chambered in 40 S&W and has a smaller body profile than full size SR40 (slide is the same size).
